intro: Diasperus bupleurodes, commonly known as the broadleaf bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky habitats. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional herbal remedies for various ailments.
